taskbody.heading: Welcome to the SYCL 2023 Survey
taskbody.body:
Hello and welcome to an online survey conducted by **@renerocksai** from the Nuremberg Institute for Market Decisions, a not-for-profit organization for researching consumer and marketing decisions, as well as the founder and anchor shareholder of GfK SE. We think you wanted to know. 

 With your help, we aim to investigate how `SYCL 2023` resonates with its attendees. Participation is voluntary.

The data collected will be anonymized and used exclusively for research purposes, and all analyses will be carried out in such a way that no conclusions from the results can be drawn about the individual taking part.

The survey will take about 5 minutes of your time. You will be asked questions about your experience at `SYCL 2023`.

### To participate in the study, please note the following:

- Please participate in the survey **without interruption**. We have set a **maximum time of 5 minutes** for each respondent to participate.

- You can **participate only once**. Participating more than once would be considered cheating.

- Please **do not use the "Back"-button of your browser**. Be brave! Blaze through the survey in one go without looking back!

Thank you very much for your support.

`If you would still like to participate in this study, please confirm the statements below and then click "Continue"`.
taskbody.agreement_check_caption: Yes, I would like to participate in the study
taskbody.please_check_agreement_msg: Please agree to the study participation
taskbody.data_protection_body: ## Data protection and privacy The survey is conducted by the Nürnberg Institut für Marktentscheidungen e.V. ("NIM") for the SYCL 2023 audience ("Client"). You will find information on data protection below. ## Consent I hereby consent that the information provided by me within the survey may be processed by NIM for the purpose of evaluating the survey and made available to the client. I am aware that I can withdraw my consent at any time. The withdrawal of consent does not affect the lawfulness of the processing carried out on the basis of the consent until the withdrawal. ## Privacy Statement Within the scope of the survey, the greatest importance is given to compliance with data protection regulations as well as the confidentiality of the data. We strictly adhere to all applicable laws and regulations on data protection, in particular the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), the German Federal Data Protection Act (BDSG) and the German Telemedia Act (TMG). With this privacy statement, we inform you about the processing of your personal data and the rights to which you are entitled. ## Controller Nürnberg Institut für Marktentscheidungen e.V. Steinstrasse 21 90419 Nürnberg Germany Tel. +49 911 9 51 51 983 Fax +49 911 37677 872 hello@nim.org ## Data Protection Officer If you have any questions to our data protection officer about data protection, please email us at mail@nim.org. Alternatively, you can also send your request to the above address (Controller). ## Scope of data processing The information you provide during the survey will be processed by NIM exclusively for the purpose of evaluating the survey. The results of the evaluation will then be forwarded to the client. The legal basis for the processing of your data is your consent (Art. 6 (1) a) GDPR). Personal data collected in the course of the survey will not be passed on to other third parties unless we are expressly obliged to do so by law. Data processing takes place exclusively within the EU. Personal data is deleted once the purpose for which it was collected no longer applies and in accordance with the statutory deletion periods. If you participate in the survey online, certain technical data, including your IP address, is automatically collected by the servers of our technical service provider when you access the website ("Usage Data"). In this respect, the technical service provider acts upon our commissioning and instruction. The Usage Data will not be processed for the purpose of evaluating the survey. ## Data Subject Rights According to the GDPR, various rights are available to data subjects. These include, in particular , the right to information pursuant to Article 15 GDPR, the right to rectification pursuant to Article 16 GDPR, the right to request the restriction of the processing of personal data concerning you pursuant to Article 18 GDPR, the right to erasure pursuant to Article 17 GDPR and the right to data portability pursuant to Article 20 GDPR. In accordance with the GDPR, data subjects also have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority. ## Right of objection In the event that your personal data is processed on the basis of legitimate interests pursuant to Art. 6 (1) (f) GDPR, you have the right to object to the processing of your personal data pursuant to Art. 21 GDPR, provided that there are grounds for doing so that arise from your particular situation or the objection is directed against direct advertising. In the latter case, you have a general right to object, which is implemented without specifying a particular situation. ## General Privacy Statement of NIM General information on data proctection at NIM can be found at https://www.nim.org/en/data-protection-declaration.
taskbody.data_protection_check_caption: I agree to the data protection and privacy statement

taskbody.body: To get started, we would like to ask you a few questions about yourself.

G.Question: What best describes your role in the Zig community?

taskbody.body: Please let your choice indicate where your answer fits on the awesomeness scpectrum.

Overall.Question: How are you liking the SYCL 2023 **experience** so far

Location.Question: How are you liking the SYCL 2023 **location** so far?

taskbody.body: Thank you very much for your participation in our experiment.
